data.title: East Central College
data.text:
Past Featured Falcons

Stacy Langan

Hometown – Marshall, MO

Executive Assistant to the President

What do you enjoy about working at ECC?

What the College offers the community and our students, how the institution values work/life balance, the benefits, and of course, my colleagues!

If you could have any superpower, what would it be?

My superpower would be animal telepathy – I’d love to know what my cat is thinking!

What is a hobby or interest you have that might surprise people?

I am obsessed with mason jars, especially odd-shaped, tiny, or very large ones.

List three words that describe you.

Compassionate, awkward and dedicated.

Blake Poertner

Hometown – Eureka, MO

Precision Machining Program Coordinator

What do you enjoy about working at ECC?

I enjoy having the freedom and support to create a machining program that I know will stand up to some of the other leaders in manufacturing education.

What is your favorite sports team?

The Blues and the Cardinals aren’t bad, but my son’s and daughter’s sports teams are my top picks for sure!

If you could visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

Jimmy Buffett. I would want to experience the man as a normal person, not just his famous side. And, of course, help him find that lost salt shaker!

Amanda Studdard

Hometown – Sullivan, MO

Multimedia Specialist - ECC

Did you attend or graduate from a community college?

Yes. I’m an ECC graduate.

What is your favorite thing to do to relax after a work week?

I enjoy going to my garden.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Buy a homestead property with 20 acres, a garden and a house.

What’s the first concert you ever attended?

Webb Wilder or Kevin Gordon

List three words that describe you.

Artistic, homesteader and mother

What is your dream job?

To become an educator or instructor for future Surgical Technologists.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

I’d be Scooby Doo because he always gets the best action, and the best meals.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to be the best version of myself while working as a CST, which in the end, is the best thing you can do for patients.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

I’d bring my dog, Beau.

Nina Tweedy

Hometown – St. Clair, MO

Welding

What is one thing you have learned this week?

How to transition from school to the outside working world.

What is your dream job?

To build tiny homes from shipping containers.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Pay off my car and buy a house for my daughter and I.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I like pop songs covered by metal bands. My favorite bands are A Day to Remember and Beartooth.

Mary Beth Romine

Hometown – Rolla, MO

Nursing

What is your dream job?

I want to become a Doctor of Nurse Anesthesia Practice (DNAP), so I am continuing my education.

What is something unique about you?

I love to play disc golf! I also live on a family farm with my great-grandparents, parents, and aunt. We all have our own homes on the land, but being close to my support system keeps me grounded.

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

My great-grandmother’s teriyaki stir fry.

List three words that describe you.

Ambitious, honest, and caring

Bonnie Eversmeyer

Hometown – Washington, MO

HVAC & Business

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

Helping the less fortunate when it comes to heating and cooling their home.

If you could visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

Sitting Bull and Crazy Horse

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

I enjoy coming home after a long day of working and loving all my critters... cats, dogs, chickens, ducks, turkeys, mini pigs, snakes, bearded dragon, and ferrets.

List three words that describe you.

Energetic, fun and caring

Taylor Rowald

Hometown – St. Clair, MO

Fine Arts

What is your dream job?

My dream job is to become an Architect and one day own my own business.

What is something unique about you?

I designed the tattoo that I had put on my arm.

What would you name the autobiography of your life

“My Life Taylor’d to Me”

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to create beautifully structured homes for families to one day live in.

List three words that describe you.

Goofy, caring and stubborn

Addison Klophaus

Hometown – St. Clair, MO

History

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

I loved my Theatre Appreciation class last semester

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I love Alternative, and my favorite band is Ghost

If you had the opportunity to visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

Alexander Hamilton, because I just want to know what is going on through his mind

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to ensure that women are continuously treated equally

Elijah Long

Hometown – St. Clair, MO

Computer Science

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

Plans? Where we’re going, we don’t need plans!

What is your dream job?

I have about 42 dream jobs. The wildest one is to own a car manufacturing company that makes fun, affordable cars for everyone.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Probably freak out, then drive to the Lego store.

What is something unique about you?

One of my many dreams is to live out of a van and take it all over the globe.

Briseyda Ballou

Hometown – Union, MO

Nursing

What is something unique about you?

I’m part Honduran and speak fluent Spanish.

What is one thing you have learned this week?

How to treat and diagnose patients with musculoskeletal diseases or deficiencies.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Travel the world.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I would like to help people from different demographics and hopefully make a difference in their lives physically and mentally.

Amy Studdard

Hometown – Rolla, MO

Nursing

What is your dream job?

A Registered nurse in a trauma center or a traveling registered nurse.

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Arroz Con Pollo

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Binge-watch “All American” and “Grey’s Anatomy” on Netflix, spend time with my 2 boys, shop with friends, and nap!

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

“Nurse Amy - Medicine Woman”

Hunter Sperry

Hometown – Union, MO

Engineering

What is your dream job?

R&D (Research and Development) propulsion engineer for spacecraft.

What is one thing you have learned this week?

The secret to making a perfect meringue.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Sherlock Holmes, minus the drug issues.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

Help people realize that no one is “bad” at math.

List three words that describe you.

Motivated, compassionate and modest.

Hallelujah Medlock

Hometown – Sullivan, MO

Fine Arts

What is your dream job?

To be a well-known freelance artist that can make enough of a living wage from my crafts to live off the grid.

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

“Remember that one time? No? I do.”

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I like all music except the kind that screams in my ear.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I don’t need to make a difference in the world, just in my own life and in the lives around me.

Fiona Giddens

Hometown – Rolla, MO

Associates of Arts Biology

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to make a difference in the medical field by creating meaningful connections with my patients and their families.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I love Fleetwood Mac.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

My favorite books. When I took public speaking, I did multiple speeches about books, and I love showing off my library.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Go to Sephora.

Tyrell Burrell-Sanders

Hometown – Pacific, MO

Media & Communications

What is your dream job?

To work in the professional level whether it’s the NBA, WNBA, NFL, etc. as their media content creator. Being able to work with the pros and being able to experience what an athlete does within their day would be amazing and dream come true for me.

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

Media production because I get to dip my feet into the media world and get a little taste of what my future career would look like.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Take my little sister on a trip somewhere we both agree to go to. It wouldn’t matter if it was in a different state or country, we would be gone ASAP.

Shelby Kelemen

Hometown – Catawissa, MO

Nursing

What is your dream job?

Travel Nurse

What is one thing you have learned this week?

Do not get a dog when you’re in college.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

Soccer & Rangers FC

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Spaghetti

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Wonder Woman

List three words that describe you.

Caring, selfless and dedicated.

Tony Kingston

Hometown – Lonedell, MO

General Education

It’s finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Laze around in my favorite pj’s and play Stardew valley.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

The Chiefs but only because Taylor Swift is backing them.

If you had to eat one meal every day, what would it be?

My dad’s 5 cheese lasagna.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

My Parakeets

List three words that describe you.

Silly, understanding, and loveable.

Megan Rhoads

Hometown – Lonedell, MO

Science Education

What is one thing you have learned this week?

That the speed of light travels 300,000 kilometers per second. That is traveling from PA to LA California 33 times! That’s FAST!

What would you name your autobiography?

“Against all Odds: My story of triumph and resilience”

If you had to eat one meal every day, what would it be?

Chinese cuisine, all day.

What difference do you want to make in the world?

How people see “disabled people.” I wasn’t always disabled and seeing how things were before my disability to now really helps me understand how people who are disabled feel.

TJ McQueen

Hometown – St. Clair, MO

Nursing

What is your dream job?

To build upon my cosmetology experience and expound my skill set as an aesthetic nurse to continue helping people look and feel their best.

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Relax? In nursing school?? That doesn’t happen.

What would you do if you won the lottery?

Travel the world.

What difference do you want to make in the world?

I’m a very transformative person and believe in the endless pursuit of growth. I believe anyone is capable of progressing throughout life and should never stop learning and trying new things.

Adina LaBeaume

Hometown – Washington, MO

Arts and Humanities

What kind of music do you like?

My favorite genres are probably shoegaze and folk.

What’s the first concert you ever attended?

My mom took me to see Miley Cyrus in 2009 thinking it was Hannah Montana.

What difference do you want to make in the world?

I hope, with my writing, to not necessarily change their worldview to match my own, but to open people’s minds to the idea that other worldviews exist and are equally valid.

List three words that describe you.

Thoughtful, curious and kind.

Rose Hayden

Hometown – Union, MO

Medical Assisting

What is one thing you have learned this week?

Be still and trust God. He has everything under control.

What would you name your autobiography?

"Blooming Roses"

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Various forms of alfredo but steak alfredo is the best.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

My favorite sport would probably be dance. I was on the dance team in high school and I loved dancing at a studio and doing recitals.

Konner Rainey

Hometown – Union, MO

Engineering

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

My favorite class is Drawing 1, followed up by Digital Design.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I like Indie Rock; (the band) Mother Mother comes to mind as well as Fitz and The Tantrums.

If you had the opportunity to visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

Leonardo da Vinci

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

"It's always a little Rainey"

List three words that describe you.

Tall, gentle and curly

Brenna Moore

Hometown – Pacific, MO

English

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Put on a YouTube video or podcast and crochet or cross stitch.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

80s hairbands, classical, indie rock and K-pop

If you had the opportunity to visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

Julia Child

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

My Pokémon pin collection.

Kristian Speaks

Hometown – Bourbon

Theatre

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

Acting/Directing & Creative Writing

What is something unique about you?

I do cosplay and go to conventions.

What's the first concert you ever attended?

Lindsey Stirling

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Pasta salad

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to entertain people the best I can, and make a lasting impact.

August Schaefer

Hometown – St. Martins, MO

Culinary Arts

What is your dream job?

A chef at Disney World.

What is something unique about you?

I have worked catering events for two Missouri governors.

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

Baking 101: Nutrition and Menu Planning

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

A stray black cat named Garry that thinks he lives with me. He is the sweetest thing on this earth and he keeps me from missing my pets back home.

Paige DeClue

Hometown – Moselle, MO

Fine Art (Graphics)

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Play on the Nintendo Switch and hang out with my pet cat.

What is something unique about you?

I collect old books and old clocks.

What type of work would you like to do after you graduate from East Central College?

Make posters or billboards, album covers also sound fun. I just want to draw!

List three words that describe you.

Funny, interesting and odd.

Alex Robbins

Hometown – Lee's Summit, MO

Industrial Engineering Technologies

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

I love all of the labs! I'm a very hands-on learner and being in labs really helps me grasp information better. I loved industrial controls wiring!

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Wonder Woman

What is something unique about you?

I was a swimmer my whole life. From the age of 3. I trained for the Olympics from 15 until the age of 21.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

Probably my dog. She's the best!

Joelle Phillips

Hometown – Rolla, MO

Certificate of Achievement in Welding

What is your dream job?

Aviation Maintenance Technician, like my dad was.

What is something unique about you?

I love to longboard, rollerblade, and play Pokémon GO.

What's the first concert you ever attended?

Building 429

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Sushi from Mottomo, in Rolla

List three words that describe you.

Determined (a nice way of saying stubborn), passionate and kind

Parker Williamson

Hometown – Sullivan, MO

Graphic Design & Ceramics

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I want to show younger artists that it's possible to follow your dreams and make a living of it.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Buy everything I need for an at-home ceramics studio!

What is something unique about you?

I've watched the show "Friends" 34 times… and counting.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

A mug I just recently made with my 2 cats' paw prints, names, and faces on each side.

Adam Vancil

Hometown – Union, MO

Psychology

What is your dream job?

The plan is to be a high school counselor, but the backup plan is to own a comfort food truck!

If you had the opportunity to visit a famous person from the past, who would it be?

My Hero, Robin Williams.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

To help fight the mental health crisis and lower suicide rates.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

My D&D (Dungeons & Dragons) dice with Blue Stegosauruses.

Caroline Miller

Hometown – Washington, MO

Secondary Education

What is your dream job?

My dream job is to be a high school English teacher. I eventually want to get my Masters in Library Science and work at a state library.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

I swam in high school, so I loved watching swimming during the Olympics. I straight up love the Olympics, though, and I avidly watch it every day when it rolls around.

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

My one meal would have to be salad, since there are so many types: fruit salad, regular salad, dessert salad, etc.

Riley Klekamp

Hometown – New Haven, MO

Criminology

Are you a first-generation college student?

I sure am!

What is something unique about you?

I can only taste on one side of my tongue. It's a little weird but quite useful!

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Probably nachos. I love a good plate of nachos.

What would you bring to Show and Tell if it were held in an ECC class?

I would bring some of my rare, expensive Pokémon cards. Kind of an odd flex, but some of these cards are my pride and joy.

Kylie Glover

Hometown – Piedmont, MO

Culinary Arts

What is your dream job?

To get a doctorate in a food science and have the title, "Dr. Chef Glover."

What is something unique about you?

I'm pretty decent at balancing things on my head while walking.

What is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Get dinner somewhere new.

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

Convert a bus to live and travel in.

List three words that describe you.

Anomaly, imaginative and vivacious

Lindsey Nichols

Hometown – Steelville, MO

English

What is your dream job?

My dream job is to be a linguist so I can learn the history and role of languages for different people and cultures.

What is something unique about you?

I've been to all 48 contiguous U.S. states.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I am not sure just yet. I have different ideas, but I want to enjoy my journey.

List three words that describe you.

Creative, inquisitive and nervous

Briannah Tiarks

Hometown – Columbia, Illinois

Environmental Engineering

What is your dream Job?

Senior environmental engineer

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

Chicago Cubs, Bears, Blackhawks

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

Transferring to Missouri S&T

What is your favorite thing to do to relax after a week of classes?

Hang out with my two cats, Lemmy and Oreo.

What difference do you want to make in the world?

Being an environmental engineer helps me leave the world a better place than when I found it.

David Braun

Hometown – Union, MO

CIS/Cybersecurity

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

I've loved American History, Psychology, Digital Design, Ethics and Intro to Security.

Is you had the opportunity to visit a famous person, who would it be?

George Washington or Aristotle.

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

"No Brain, All Braun"

List three words that describe you.

Optimistic, resourceful and dependable.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I just want to help people in any way I can.

Dakayla McClain

Hometown – Sullivan, MO

Psychology

List three words that describe you.

Strong, responsible and determined.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Give some to my parents and put the rest away to build interest.

It is finally Friday, what is your favorite thing to do to relax after a week of classes?

Watch Netflix or YouTube.

If you had the opportunity to visit a famous person, who would it be? What would you ask them?

Stephen Curry. I would ask about his success and how faith is a part of it, and just have a regular conversation with him.

Emma Thomas

Hometown – Union, MO

Liberal Studies

What is your dream job?

I would love to work in a museum as a curator.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Clifford the Big Red Dog. I am short, so it would be nice to tower over everyone for a change.

What is something unique about you?

I collect K-pop albums, which include CDs, photo books/cards, posters, etc. It is an addictive, expensive hobby for me.

What difference do you want to make in the world after graduating from ECC?

I am not sure just yet. I have different ideas, but I want to enjoy my journey.

What is your dream job?

Taking care of family and friends.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

I don't much follow sports except for baseball. I'm a Midwest boy, is there another team besides the Cardinals?

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

I haven't thought that far ahead. Are they kicking me out?

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

I have enjoyed all my classes so far.

List three words that describe you.

Curious, cranky and mischievous

Damian Kunc

Hometown – Dundee, Scotland

Born in Poland

Liberal Studies

What is your dream job?

Professional Soccer player

What is something unique about you?

People don't believe me when I say I am Polish because I have a Scottish accent.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Book multiple holidays

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

Go to a four-year college/university and carry on with my soccer scholarship.

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Spicy chicken and lettuce wrap

Dylan Agee

Hometown – St. Charles

Business

What is your dream job?

Music entrepreneur

What is something unique about you?

I know how to play multiple instruments.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Hire a lawyer and throw my phone away.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Finn from "Adventure Time"

If you had to eat one meal every day for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Chicken and rice

List three words that describe you.

Meticulous, adventurous and compassionate

Jack Ridley

Hometown – Perth, Scotland

Business

What is your dream job?

To become coach of St. Louis City SC

What is something unique about you?

I had no siblings until the age of 13 and now I have 3.

What are your plans after leaving ECC?

Transfer to a four-year school, continue playing soccer and get my degree.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Bart Simpson

What is the first concert you ever attended?

Lewis Capaldi

Mikala Saler-Becker

Hometown – San Jose, California

Social Sciences: Psychology

What are your favorite classes at ECC?

Ceramics 2 is quite fun and different. It's a nice break and I love creating new things.

Something unique?

I've started a club here at ECC, DSA or Democratic Socialists of America.

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Hermione Granger from Harry Potter. I love magic, but I also like how talented and intelligent she is.

What difference do you want to make?

To leave things better than when I found them, to help people when I can and to make an impact on the lives of those around me.

Aaron Bounds

Hometown – Hermann

Assistant Professor, Music / Band Director

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I listen to all music but jazz is a personal favorite. I've been listening to "Somethin' Else" by Cannonball Adderly

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

"Go Practice."

What's the first concert you ever attended?

Weezer at the Hearnes Center

What is something unique about you?

I participated in Drum and Bugle Corps marching with the Madison Scouts for two summers.

Kim Aguilar

Hometown – Washington

HR Generalist

What is your favorite thing to do to relax?

Order pizza and watch a movie with my husband and kids. And then get ice cream.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I like a variety... Kendrick Lamar to City Colour and everything in-between.

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

"Simple, but Cool"

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Spider-Man

List three words that describe you.

Friendly. Laid-back. Caring.

Bridgette Kelch

Hometown – Washington

Executive Director of the Foundation

What is something unique about you?

My husband and I have a life goal of visiting all 420+ National Park sites. We have currently visited 200.

What is your favorite sport/sports team?

Theatre

What would you do if you won the lottery?

Never claim it publicly and immediately speak with a lawyer, CPA and financial advisor. Then save any historic structure in danger, give endowed funds to all my favorite local charities, and fund green initiatives for public education and local municipalities.

List three words that describe you.

Generous, kind and clever

Melissa Richards

Clover Bottom, MO

Center for Workforce Development Apprenticeship & Business Training Coordinator

Something unique about you?

I never wore dresses until I started working with Cindy Brinker—I like her style.

Favorite thing to do to relax?

Pack up and go camping at the lake for the weekend.

Favorite sports team?

Soccer was my sport to play, but I love attending a St. Louis Blues game.

Three words that describe you?

Go-getter, reliable, nurturing.

First thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Pay off my and my family's debt, then go on a dream vacation.

Richard Hudanick

Hometown – Alton, IL

Dean of Career and Technical Education

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Spider-Man! He has old-school power!

What is your favorite thing to do to relax after a work week?

I enjoy a 5-mile run and run in all types of weather! When opportunity exists, I will run the Katy Trail at Dutzow in a new snow fall.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

My go-to genre is classic rock! Led Zeppelin (LZ) is very often listened to, yet my interests are broad.

List three words that describe you.

Introspective. Dedicated. Heartfelt.

What is your favorite thing to do to relax after a work week?

A casual dinner with my wife and children.

What is you favorite sport/sports team?

My favorite sport is football and my favorite sports team is the St. Louis Cardinals.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

I would seek either Bruce Springsteen or The Rolling Stones to play at my retirement party.

What would you name the autobiography of your life?

"Blue Collar Son, White Collar Man: Class Straddling in Modern America"

Brooklyn Hyatt

St. Clair

Education

Dream Job?

Teach 2nd grade at St. Clair Elementary

Plans after leaving ECC?

Transfer to a four-year school. Maybe SEMO.

What difference do you want to make in the world?

I want to be able to support those of us who need it most.

Favorite music?

I love all music EXCEPT country. I really like Panic at The Disco and Paramore.

Three words that describe you?

Loud, Considerate, Intelligent

First thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Buy my Nana an apartment.

Favorite thing to do to relax?

Take our dog, Sky, on a long walk, then watch a British murder mystery

What is something unique about you?

I lived & worked in West Africa (the Ivory Coast) for a year and a half.

Favorite sport?

Olympics!

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

Jane Bennet from "Pride and Prejudice"

What kind of music do you like? Band?

All music! Paul Simon's Graceland, Roisin Murphy, Otis Redding, Radiohead

Abby Stanfield

Union, MO

Fine Arts

What are some of your favorite classes at ECC?

I'm really liking Ceramics and Drawing 2.

What is your dream job?

Ideally, I'd like to be a freelance artist.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I listen to just about anything and everything. Lately, I've been listening to a lot of Peach Pit.

What is something unique about you?

I was homeschooled from 3rd grade through high school.

What's the first concert you ever attended?

Shinedown

Ryan Mier

San Antonio, TX

Pre-Engineering

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?

The main character of Stardew Valley.

What kind of music do you like? Band?

Electro-Swing. Or3o.

If you had to eat one meal for the rest of your life, what would it be?

Subway Sandwich

What difference do you want to make in the world?

Invent something that would make mass communication easier.

List three words that describe you.

Blunt

Awkward

Helpful

Ethan Mier

St. Clair, MO

Fine Arts

What kind of music do you like? Band?

I like alternative music or grunge but my favorite band at the moment is AJR.

What is the first thing you would do if you won the lottery?

Start my own animation studio

If you could be any fictional character, who would you choose?
